segment.source: The calendar date picker is a drop down control that’s optimized for picking a single date from a calendar view where contextual information like the day of the week or fullness of the calendar is important.
segment.target: The calendar date picker is a drop down control that’s optimized for picking a single date from a calendar view where contextual information like the day of the week or fullness of the calendar is important.

segment.source: Calendar date picker
segment.target: Calendar date picker

segment.source: Calendar date picker
segment.target: Calendar date picker

segment.source: The calendar date picker is a drop down control that’s optimized for picking a single date from a calendar view where contextual information like the day of the week or fullness of the calendar is important.
segment.target: The calendar date picker is a drop down control that’s optimized for picking a single date from a calendar view where contextual information like the day of the week or fullness of the calendar is important.

segment.source: You can modify the calendar to provide additional context or to limit available dates.
segment.target: You can modify the calendar to provide additional context or to limit available dates.

segment.source: Important APIs
segment.target: Important APIs

segment.source: TimePicker class
segment.target: TimePicker class

segment.source: Time property
segment.target: Time property

segment.source: Is this the right control?
segment.target: Is this the right control?

segment.source: Use a calendar date picker to let a user pick a single date from a contextual calendar view.
segment.target: Use a calendar date picker to let a user pick a single date from a contextual calendar view.

segment.source: Use it for things like choosing an appointment or departure date.
segment.target: Use it for things like choosing an appointment or departure date.

segment.source: To let a user pick a known date, such as a date of birth, where the context of the calendar is not important, consider using a date picker.
segment.target: To let a user pick a known date, such as a date of birth, where the context of the calendar is not important, consider using a date picker.

segment.source: For more info about choosing the right control, see the Date and time controls article.
segment.target: For more info about choosing the right control, see the Date and time controls article.

segment.source: Examples
segment.target: Examples

segment.source: The entry point displays placeholder text if a date has not been set; otherwise, it displays the chosen date.
segment.target: The entry point displays placeholder text if a date has not been set; otherwise, it displays the chosen date.

segment.source: When the user selects the entry point, a calendar view expands for the user to make a date selection.
segment.target: When the user selects the entry point, a calendar view expands for the user to make a date selection.

segment.source: The calendar view overlays other UI; it doesn't push other UI out of the way.
segment.target: The calendar view overlays other UI; it doesn't push other UI out of the way.

segment.source: Example of calendar date picker
segment.target: Example of calendar date picker

segment.source: Create a date picker
segment.target: Create a date picker

segment.source: The resulting calendar date picker looks like this:
segment.target: The resulting calendar date picker looks like this:

segment.source: Example of calendar date picker
segment.target: Example of calendar date picker

segment.source: The calendar date picker has an internal CalendarView for picking a date.
segment.target: The calendar date picker has an internal CalendarView for picking a date.

segment.source: A subset of CalendarView properties, like IsTodayHighlighted and FirstDayOfWeek, exist on CalendarDatePicker and are forwarded to the internal CalendarView to let you modify it.
segment.target: A subset of CalendarView properties, like IsTodayHighlighted and FirstDayOfWeek, exist on CalendarDatePicker and are forwarded to the internal CalendarView to let you modify it.

segment.source: However, you can't change the SelectionMode of the internal CalendarView to allow multiple selection.
segment.target: However, you can't change the SelectionMode of the internal CalendarView to allow multiple selection.

segment.source: If you need to let a user pick multiple dates or need a calendar to be always visible, consider using a calendar view instead of a calendar date picker.
segment.target: If you need to let a user pick multiple dates or need a calendar to be always visible, consider using a calendar view instead of a calendar date picker.

segment.source: See the Calendar view article for more info on how you can modify the calendar display.
segment.target: See the Calendar view article for more info on how you can modify the calendar display.

segment.source: Selecting dates
segment.target: Selecting dates

segment.source: Use the Date property to get or set the selected date.
segment.target: Use the Date property to get or set the selected date.

segment.source: By default, the Date property is null.
segment.target: By default, the Date property is null.

segment.source: When a user selects a date in the calendar view, this property is updated.
segment.target: When a user selects a date in the calendar view, this property is updated.

segment.source: A user can clear the date by clicking the selected date in the calendar view to deselect it.
segment.target: A user can clear the date by clicking the selected date in the calendar view to deselect it.

segment.source: You can set the date in your code like this.
segment.target: You can set the date in your code like this.

segment.source: When you set the Date in code, the value is constrained by the MinDate and MaxDate properties.
segment.target: When you set the Date in code, the value is constrained by the MinDate and MaxDate properties.

segment.source: If Date is smaller than MinDate, the value is set to MinDate.
segment.target: If Date is smaller than MinDate, the value is set to MinDate.

segment.source: If Date is greater than MaxDate, the value is set to MaxDate.
segment.target: If Date is greater than MaxDate, the value is set to MaxDate.

segment.source: You can handle the DateChanged event to be notified when the Date value has changed.
segment.target: You can handle the DateChanged event to be notified when the Date value has changed.

segment.source: NoteFor important info about date values, see DateTime and Calendar values in the Date and time controls article.
segment.target: NoteFor important info about date values, see DateTime and Calendar values in the Date and time controls article.

segment.source: Setting a header and placeholder text
segment.target: Setting a header and placeholder text

segment.source: You can add a Header (or label) and PlaceholderText (or watermark) to the calendar date picker to give the user an indication of what it's used for.
segment.target: You can add a Header (or label) and PlaceholderText (or watermark) to the calendar date picker to give the user an indication of what it's used for.

segment.source: To customize the look of the header, you can set the HeaderTemplate property instead of Header.
segment.target: To customize the look of the header, you can set the HeaderTemplate property instead of Header.

segment.source: The default placeholder text is "select a date".
segment.target: The default placeholder text is "select a date".

segment.source: You can remove this by setting the PlaceholderText property to an empty string, or you can provide custom text as shown here.
segment.target: You can remove this by setting the PlaceholderText property to an empty string, or you can provide custom text as shown here.

segment.source: \[This article contains information that is specific to Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps and Windows 10.
segment.target: \[This article contains information that is specific to Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps and Windows 10.
